orchestrator.goal: Coordinate satellites and instruments to achieve the global image and final pointing goals while minimizing total time.

public_information: 5 modes available: image1, image2, thermograph0, thermograph3, thermograph4
25 named directions (stars, ground stations, phenomena, planets)
Actions have durations and interval preconditions/effects
Each satellite has a single shared power feed for its instruments
A satellite can point at exactly one direction at a time; turning takes 5 time units and leaves satellite unpointed during turn
Switch-on duration 2 (claims power at start, instrument powered at end)
Switch-off duration 1 (instrument unpowered at start, power freed at end)
Calibrate duration 5 (requires instrument powered throughout and satellite pointing at calibration target at start; instrument calibrated at end)
Take-image duration 7 (requires instrument powered and calibrated throughout and satellite pointing at target throughout; image obtained at end)

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL problems (satellite domain). You will be provided complete environment information and agents' private constraints. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem encoding the temporal satellite-instrument imaging problem, with actions, durations, start/over/ end preconditions and effects, static relations, initial state, goals, and objective to minimize total-time. Keep agent-specific actions and resources explicit (per-satellite power feed, per-instrument calibration). Do not assume anything beyond the provided facts. Return domain and problem enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
Satellite0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite0->private_information}.
Satellite1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite1->private_information}.
Satellite2's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite2->private_information}.
Satellite3's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite3->private_information}.
Satellite4's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite4->private_information}.
Satellite5's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->satellite5->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a temporal PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent and the specified durations, preconditions over intervals, and exclusive resource usages. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
